title: Walz Is Wrong: President Trump’s Immigration Policies Are Saving Lives
content:
What exactly does Tim Walz find so objectionable about enforcing our nation’s immigration laws? In his pathetic, inflammatory press conference today, Walz bizarrely claimed {% set i = i + 1 %}“there is no verifiable evidence” that President Donald J. Trump’s immigration enforcement operations are “making America safer.”{% set i = i + 1 %}

Radical Left lunatics{% set i = i + 1 %} like Walz, blinded by their deep delusions and seething hatred{% set i = i + 1 %} for President Trump, have become completely untethered from reality{% set i = i + 1 %} — ignoring the indisputable evidence{% set i = i + 1 %} that President Trump’s immigration policies are literally saving lives{% set i = i + 1 %}:

The nation likely saw the largest-ever{% set i = i + 1 %} one-year drop in homicides in 2025 — with especially steep drops{% set i = i + 1 %} in cities where the Trump Administration undertook targeted immigration enforcement and crime prevention operations.

For example, a single immigration enforcement operation in Florida resulted in the arrest of 150 illegal alien sex offenders{% set i = i + 1 %}, while operations in Chicago drove a dramatic decrease in violent crime{% set i = i + 1 %}.

A staggering 70% of the 650,000+ illegal aliens{% set i = i + 1 %} deported by the Trump Administration since taking office have been charged with or convicted of crimes. Deaths of on-duty law enforcement officers dropped by nearly 25%{% set i = i + 1 %} in 2025. Traffic fatalities have dropped dramatically{% set i = i + 1 %}, with eased congestion in high-immigration cities{% set i = i + 1 %} and the removal of more than 9,500 non-English-speaking commercial truck drivers{% set i = i + 1 %} who posed safety risks on our roadways{% set i = i + 1 %}. Fentanyl trafficking across the southern border has been slashed in half{% set i = i + 1 %}, leading to lower fentanyl purity levels{% set i = i + 1 %} and fewer overdose deaths{% set i = i + 1 %} ravaging American families.

Emergency rooms report significant reductions{% set i = i + 1 %} in illegal immigrant visits, freeing up critical resources to better serve American citizens in need of urgent medical care.

The share of Americans viewing crime as a “very” serious issue fell by nearly 15%{% set i = i + 1 %} in 2025, reflecting the real-world impact of President Trump’s approach on everyday Americans’ lives.

It is an indisputable fact that President Trump’s immigration policies are saving American citizens from being killed, raped, and assaulted{% set i = i + 1 %} at the hands of criminal illegal aliens with no right to be here{% set i = i + 1 %}.

If Walz and Democrats find that troublesome, it only further exposes their disturbing priorities{% set i = i + 1 %} — putting criminals ahead of Americans{% set i = i + 1 %}.
